name: ITP - H1501A - Tupiko Stream Bridge - Reinforced Slope (Rock Bolts, Soil Nails)
template name: ITP - H1501A - Tupiko Stream Bridge - Reinforced Slope (Rock Bolts, Soil Nails)

name: Detail - Once on site the Contractor shall confirm the condition and dimensions of the structure.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - The CPS Engineer shall be informed immediately if any conflicts in dimensions are encountered.
Detail - ESC measures shall be designed and maintained by the contractor during the period of the works
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Ensure no surface runoff flows over temporary excavations
Detail - Before setout of the reinforced slope method the bank along the full length of the abutment shall be trimmed/excavated to remove all loose material.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Keep excavation to a minimum
Detail - Founding materials shall be inspected and verified by a geotechnical Engineer on site
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Any soft or unsuitable soil shall be excavated and replaced with lean concrete (minimum compression strength of 10MPa at 28 days)
Detail - Contractor shall submit their construction methodology for the trial anchors to the CPS Engineer at least 3 days prior to anchor installation.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Submission
Detail - All reinforcement shall meet design specifications
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - Grade 500E and shall comply with AS/NZS 4671
Detail - All steel solid bar anchor ties are to meet design specifications. Alternative anchor systems will be considered provided they achieve the intent of these works
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - 20mm diameter grade 500E Reidbar or similar approved, and hot dip galvanised in accordance with AS/NZS 4680:2006. Damaged bars are to be rejected.
Detail - Bearing plate steel, coupling hex nuts and other accessories must meet design specifications.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review

Conformance Criteria - Bearing plate steel: Minimum yield strength of 250MPa, min 200x200x12mm.
All galvanised to HDG600
Detail - All concrete to meet design specifications
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - Workmanship in accordance with NZS 3109 and meets minimum 28-day compressive strength of 30 Mpa

Detail - Contractor should employ an IANZ accredited laboratory to perform one compressive strength test for every anchor at 1,7, and 28 days in accordance with NZS 3112.4. Test results shall be supplied to the CPS Engineer within 24 hours of testing.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Testing
Conformance Criteria - Anchor grout shall be Sika grout 212 or similar as approved by the Engineer and is required to achieve minimum characteristic strength of 20MPa at 7 days and 30MPa at 28 days.
Records - Lab test results to CONQA Procore

Detail - Three sacrificial soil nail tests are required by the Engineer. Location will be agreed on site with CPS Engineer. Testing may only commence once the grout has reached 30MPa as confirmed by grout cylinder testing.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Testing
Conformance Criteria - Grout test results to be provided to the CPS Engineer prior to nail testing.
○ Test equipment certificates and calibration certificates submitted to CPS Engineer prior to testing.
○ Sacrificial test anchors and production anchors shall comply with Section 3.4 Table 1.
○ Test results shall be provided to the CPS Engineer for approval within 24 hours of testing
Records - Lab test results to CONQA Procore
Detail - Three production anchors shall be proof tested in a location agreed with the CPS Engineer. All remaining production anchors shall be acceptance tested.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Testing

Conformance Criteria - Testing done in accordance with Section 3.5, test results provided to the CPS Engineer for approval within 24 hours of testing. Rejection of anchors in accordance with Section 3.6
Records - Test results to CONQA Procore
Detail - Anchors shall be installed in accordance with the lines, lengths and levels shown in drawings.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Measure
Conformance Criteria - Bonded length of anchors is minimum 4m. Upper row installed at 10 degrees downward from horizontal. Lower row installed at 35 degrees downward from horizontal.
○ Anchor drilling, hole cleaning, anchor installation and grouting shall be completed within 24 hours of commencement. No holes are to be left open overnight.
Records - Photos identifying anchors and installed locations
Detail - The contractor shall keep a record for each individual ground anchor and submit these to the CPS Engineer
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Submission
– Prestressing steel manufacturer's mill test reports for the solid bars incorporated in the installation
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection

Conformance Criteria - The entire length of the nail should be grouted without voids, intrusion of soil, or gaps in the grouted column. Grouted columns are not to be leaded for at least 72 hours after grouting.
Detail - Install bearing plates and washers/nuts
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Bearing plates (anchor heads) are required to be buried within the mass of the skirt concrete block.
○ Tie rod nuts are to be snug tightened only to remove any slack.
Detail - Reinforcement shall be installed in accordance with Section 3.8.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection

Detail - Sub horizontal filter wrapped slotted pipes to be installed as shown on design plan. Outlet pipes shall be installed along the front face of the concrete block to form weepholes as per construction drawings.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Drains shall be installed in 65mm diameter drilled holes at 10 degrees upward from horizontal.
Detail - When completed the subdrains shall be inspected by a geotechnical Engineer on site
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Detail - Ensure any cavities and surface is clean prior to application of concrete
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Detail - Apply concrete in specified locations
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Detail - All concrete shall be properly cured for a period of seven days or until specified strength is obtained.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Detail - Once the concrete block has been completed, the CPS Engineer must be offered the opportunity to inspect the completed works.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Detail - After completion of the works, the existing banks shall be shaped to match with the new bank.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Detail - All areas disturbed by the works shall be topsoiled and grassed except as noted.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection

Conformance Criteria - Topsoil shall be spread at a nominal thickness of 100mm, but no less than 50mm and no more than 120mm. Batters steeper than 2:1 are not to be topsoiled. Topsoil is to be tamped down to a firm state (minor indentation when stepped on).
Detail - Grassing of topsoiled areas shall be a to a mix agreed with the CPS Engineer on site.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Contractor shall apply 50 grams per square metre of superphosphate.
○ No seed is to be sown until preparation work has been approved by the Engineer.
○ The grass seed mixture shall be sown at a rate of 25 grams per square metre bare seed weight.
Detail - Ensure all NCRs are closed and included within QA file, Delivery Dockets and Lab Testing Spreadsheet and Test Reports to be included in QA File
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - Ensure all QA is uploaded into ConQA / Procore
Records - Delivery Dockets, Test Reports, Lab Testing Register, Subcontractor QA Records
Detail - Any works outside Construction tolerance and signed off on OFI or similar. As Built by Surveyor. Red line mark up drawings to be included in QA file
Frequency - During and at completion of work.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Survey / Drawings
29 - Completion Sign Off From Fields Below
Detail - Below sign-offs to be Captured in CONQA / Procore
